member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeRequest
member.summary: `StreamingRecognizeRequest` is the top-level message sent by the client for the `StreamingRecognize`. Multiple `StreamingRecognizeRequest` messages are sent. The first message must contain a `streaming_config` message and must not contain `audio` data. All subsequent messages must contain `audio` data and must not contain a `streaming_config` message.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.StreamingConfigFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "streaming_config" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.StreamingConfig
member.summary:
The `streaming_config` message provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.
The first `StreamingRecognizeRequest` message must contain a `streaming_config` message.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.AudioContentFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "audio_content" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.AudioContent
member.summary: The audio data to be recognized. Sequential chunks of audio data are sent in sequential `StreamingRecognizeRequest` messages. The first `StreamingRecognizeRequest` message must not contain `audio_content` data and all subsequent `StreamingRecognizeRequest` messages must contain `audio_content` data. The audio bytes must be encoded as specified in `RecognitionConfig`. Note: as with all bytes fields, protobuffers use a pure binary representation (not base64). See [audio limits](https://cloud.google.com/speech/limits#content).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.StreamingRequestOneofCase
member.summary: Enum of possible cases for the "streaming_request" oneof.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig
member.summary: The `StreamingRecognitionConfig` message provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.ConfigFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "config" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.Config
member.summary: [Required] The `config` message provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.SingleUtteranceFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "single_utterance" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.SingleUtterance
member.summary:
[Optional] If `false` or omitted, the recognizer will perform continuous recognition (continuing to process audio even if the user pauses speaking) until the client closes the output stream (gRPC API) or when the maximum time limit has been reached. Multiple `StreamingRecognitionResult`s with the `is_final` flag set to `true` may be returned.
If `true`, the recognizer will detect a single spoken utterance. When it detects that the user has paused or stopped speaking, it will return an `END_OF_UTTERANCE` event and cease recognition. It will return no more than one `StreamingRecognitionResult` with the `is_final` flag set to `true`.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.InterimResultsFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "interim_results" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.InterimResults
member.summary: [Optional] If `true`, interim results (tentative hypotheses) may be returned as they become available (these interim results are indicated with the `is_final=false` flag). If `false` or omitted, only `is_final=true` result(s) are returned.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig
member.summary: The `RecognitionConfig` message provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.EncodingFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "encoding" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Encoding
member.summary: [Required] Encoding of audio data sent in all `RecognitionAudio` messages.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.SampleRateFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "sample_rate" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.SampleRate
member.summary: [Required] Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent in all `RecognitionAudio` messages. Valid values are: 8000-48000. 16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling).

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.LanguageCodeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "language_code" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.LanguageCode
member.summary: [Optional] The language of the supplied audio as a BCP-47 language tag. Example: "en-GB" https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt If omitted, defaults to "en-US". See [Language Support](https://cloud.google.com/speech/docs/best-practices#language_support) for a list of the currently supported language codes.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.MaxAlternativesFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "max_alternatives" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.MaxAlternatives
member.summary: [Optional] Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned. Specifically, the maximum number of `SpeechRecognitionAlternative` messages within each `SpeechRecognitionResult`. The server may return fewer than `max_alternatives`. Valid values are `0`-`30`. A value of `0` or `1` will return a maximum of `1`. If omitted, defaults to `1`.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.ProfanityFilterFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "profanity_filter" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.ProfanityFilter
member.summary: [Optional] If set to `true`, the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks, e.g. "f***". If set to `false` or omitted, profanities won't be filtered out.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.SpeechContextFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "speech_context" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.SpeechContext
member.summary: [Optional] A means to provide context to assist the speech recognition.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the RecognitionConfig message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding
member.summary:
Audio encoding of the data sent in the audio message. All encodings support only 1 channel (mono) audio. Only `FLAC` includes a header that describes the bytes of audio that follow the header. The other encodings are raw audio bytes with no header.
For best results, the audio source should be captured and transmitted using a lossless encoding (`FLAC` or `LINEAR16`). Recognition accuracy may be reduced if lossy codecs (such as AMR, AMR_WB and MULAW) are used to capture or transmit the audio, particularly if background noise is present.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.EncodingUnspecified
member.summary: Not specified. Will return result [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT][google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT].

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.Linear16
member.summary: Uncompressed 16-bit signed little-endian samples (Linear PCM). This is the only encoding that may be used by `AsyncRecognize`.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.Flac
member.summary:
This is the recommended encoding for `SyncRecognize` and `StreamingRecognize` because it uses lossless compression; therefore recognition accuracy is not compromised by a lossy codec.
The stream FLAC (Free Lossless Audio Codec) encoding is specified at: http://flac.sourceforge.net/documentation.html. 16-bit and 24-bit samples are supported. Not all fields in STREAMINFO are supported.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.Mulaw
member.summary: 8-bit samples that compand 14-bit audio samples using G.711 PCMU/mu-law.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.Amr
member.summary: Adaptive Multi-Rate Narrowband codec. `sample_rate` must be 8000 Hz.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.AmrWb
member.summary: Adaptive Multi-Rate Wideband codec. `sample_rate` must be 16000 Hz.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechContext
member.summary: Provides "hints" to the speech recognizer to favor specific words and phrases in the results.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechContext.PhrasesFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "phrases" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechContext.Phrases
member.summary: [Optional] A list of strings containing words and phrases "hints" so that the speech recognition is more likely to recognize them. This can be used to improve the accuracy for specific words and phrases, for example, if specific commands are typically spoken by the user. This can also be used to add additional words to the vocabulary of the recognizer. See [usage limits](https://cloud.google.com/speech/limits#content).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio
member.summary: Contains audio data in the encoding specified in the `RecognitionConfig`. Either `content` or `uri` must be supplied. Supplying both or neither returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT][google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT]. See [audio limits](https://cloud.google.com/speech/limits#content).

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio.ContentFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "content" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio.Content
member.summary: The audio data bytes encoded as specified in `RecognitionConfig`. Note: as with all bytes fields, protobuffers use a pure binary representation, whereas JSON representations use base64.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio.UriFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "uri" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio.Uri
member.summary: URI that points to a file that contains audio data bytes as specified in `RecognitionConfig`. Currently, only Google Cloud Storage URIs are supported, which must be specified in the following format: `gs://bucket_name/object_name` (other URI formats return [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT][google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT]). For more information, see [Request URIs](https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/reference-uris).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio.AudioSourceOneofCase
member.summary: Enum of possible cases for the "audio_source" oneof.

member.summary: Constructs a with a property referring to a Google Cloud Storage URI.
member.param: A Google Cloud Storage URI, of the form gs://bucket-name/object-name. Must not be null.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The result will be the newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The result will be the newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Constructs a by loading data from the given file path.

member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by loading data from the given file path.
member.param: The file path to load RecognitionAudio data from. Must not be null.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Constructs a by loading data from the given stream.
member.param: The stream to load RecognitionAudio data from. Must not be null.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by loading data from the given stream.
member.param: The stream to load RecognitionAudio data from. Must not be null.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio.FromBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructs a from the given byte array.
member.remarks: This method copies the data from the byte array; modifications to after this method returns will not be reflected in the RecognitionAudio.
member.param: The bytes representing the raw RecognitionAudio data.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.RecognitionAudio.FromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a from a section of the given byte array.
member.remarks: This method copies the data from the byte array; modifications to after this method returns will not be reflected in the RecognitionAudio.
member.param: The bytes representing the raw RecognitionAudio data.
The offset into the byte array of the start of the data to include in the RecognitionAudio.
The number of bytes to include in the RecognitionAudio.
member.returns: The newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SyncRecognizeResponse
member.summary: `SyncRecognizeResponse` is the only message returned to the client by `SyncRecognize`. It contains the result as zero or more sequential `SpeechRecognitionResult` messages.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SyncRecognizeResponse.ResultsFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "results" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SyncRecognizeResponse.Results
member.summary: [Output-only] Sequential list of transcription results corresponding to sequential portions of audio.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeResponse
member.summary: `AsyncRecognizeResponse` is the only message returned to the client by `AsyncRecognize`. It contains the result as zero or more sequential `SpeechRecognitionResult` messages. It is included in the `result.response` field of the `Operation` returned by the `GetOperation` call of the `google::longrunning::Operations` service.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeResponse.ResultsFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "results" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeResponse.Results
member.summary: [Output-only] Sequential list of transcription results corresponding to sequential portions of audio.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeMetadata
member.summary: `AsyncRecognizeMetadata` describes the progress of a long-running `AsyncRecognize` call. It is included in the `metadata` field of the `Operation` returned by the `GetOperation` call of the `google::longrunning::Operations` service.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeMetadata.ProgressPercentFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "progress_percent" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeMetadata.ProgressPercent
member.summary: Approximate percentage of audio processed thus far. Guaranteed to be 100 when the audio is fully processed and the results are available.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeMetadata.StartTimeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "start_time" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeMetadata.StartTime
member.summary: Time when the request was received.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeMetadata.LastUpdateTimeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "last_update_time" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeMetadata.LastUpdateTime
member.summary: Time of the most recent processing update.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse
F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.ErrorFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "error" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Error
member.summary: [Output-only] If set, returns a [google.rpc.Status][] message that specifies the error for the operation.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.ResultsFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "results" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Results
member.summary: [Output-only] This repeated list contains zero or more results that correspond to consecutive portions of the audio currently being processed. It contains zero or one `is_final=true` result (the newly settled portion), followed by zero or more `is_final=false` results.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.ResultIndexFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "result_index" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.ResultIndex
member.summary: [Output-only] Indicates the lowest index in the `results` array that has changed. The repeated `StreamingRecognitionResult` results overwrite past results at this index and higher.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.EndpointerTypeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "endpointer_type" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.EndpointerType
member.summary: [Output-only] Indicates the type of endpointer event.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the StreamingRecognizeResponse message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.EndpointerType
member.summary: Indicates the type of endpointer event.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.EndpointerType.EndpointerEventUnspecified
member.summary: No endpointer event specified.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.EndpointerType.StartOfSpeech
member.summary: Speech has been detected in the audio stream.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.EndpointerType.EndOfSpeech
member.summary: Speech has ceased to be detected in the audio stream.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.EndpointerType.EndOfAudio
member.summary: The end of the audio stream has been reached. and it is being processed.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.EndpointerType.EndOfUtterance
member.summary: This event is only sent when `single_utterance` is `true`. It indicates that the server has detected the end of the user's speech utterance and expects no additional speech. Therefore, the server will not process additional audio. The client should stop sending additional audio data.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionResult
member.summary: A streaming speech recognition result corresponding to a portion of the audio that is currently being processed.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionResult.AlternativesFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "alternatives" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionResult.Alternatives
member.summary: [Output-only] May contain one or more recognition hypotheses (up to the maximum specified in `max_alternatives`).

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionResult.IsFinalFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "is_final" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionResult.IsFinal
member.summary: [Output-only] If `false`, this `StreamingRecognitionResult` represents an interim result that may change. If `true`, this is the final time the speech service will return this particular `StreamingRecognitionResult`, the recognizer will not return any further hypotheses for this portion of the transcript and corresponding audio.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionResult.StabilityFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "stability" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognitionResult.Stability
member.summary: [Output-only] An estimate of the probability that the recognizer will not change its guess about this interim result. Values range from 0.0 (completely unstable) to 1.0 (completely stable). Note that this is not the same as `confidence`, which estimates the probability that a recognition result is correct. This field is only provided for interim results (`is_final=false`). The default of 0.0 is a sentinel value indicating stability was not set.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionResult
member.summary: A speech recognition result corresponding to a portion of the audio.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionResult.AlternativesFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "alternatives" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionResult.Alternatives
member.summary: [Output-only] May contain one or more recognition hypotheses (up to the maximum specified in `max_alternatives`).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionAlternative
member.summary: Alternative hypotheses (a.k.a. n-best list).

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionAlternative.TranscriptFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "transcript" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionAlternative.Transcript
member.summary: [Output-only] Transcript text representing the words that the user spoke.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionAlternative.ConfidenceFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "confidence" field.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechRecognitionAlternative.Confidence
member.summary: [Output-only] The confidence estimate between 0.0 and 1.0. A higher number means the system is more confident that the recognition is correct. This field is typically provided only for the top hypothesis, and only for `is_final=true` results. The default of 0.0 is a sentinel value indicating confidence was not set.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.Speech
member.summary: Service that implements Google Cloud Speech API.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.Speech.Descriptor
member.summary: Service descriptor

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.Speech.SpeechBase
member.summary: Base class for server-side implementations of Speech

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.Speech.SpeechBase.SyncRecognize(Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SyncRecognizeRequest,Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext)
member.summary: Perform synchronous speech-recognition: receive results after all audio has been sent and processed.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.Speech.SpeechBase.AsyncRecognize(Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.AsyncRecognizeRequest,Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext)
member.summary: Perform asynchronous speech-recognition: receive results via the google.longrunning.Operations interface. Returns either an `Operation.error` or an `Operation.response` which contains an `AsyncRecognizeResponse` message.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.Speech.SpeechBase.StreamingRecognize(Grpc.Core.IAsyncStreamReader{Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeRequest},Grpc.Core.IServerStreamWriter{Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.StreamingRecognizeResponse},Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext)
member.summary: Perform bidirectional streaming speech-recognition: receive results while sending audio. This method is only available via the gRPC API (not REST).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.Speech.SpeechClient
member.summary: Client for Speech

member.summary: Creates a new client for Speech
member.param: The channel to use to make remote calls.

member.summary: Creates a new client for Speech that uses a custom CallInvoker.
member.param: The callInvoker to use to make remote calls.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechSettings.IdempotentRetryFilter
member.summary: The filter specifying which RPC s are eligible for retry for "Idempotent" RPC methods.
member.remarks: The eligible RPC s for retry for "Idempotent" RPC methods are:

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechSettings.NonIdempotentRetryFilter
member.summary: The filter specifying which RPC s are eligible for retry for "NonIdempotent" RPC methods.
member.remarks: There are no RPC s eligible for retry for "NonIdempotent" RPC methods.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechSettings.GetDefaultRetryBackoff
member.summary: "Default" retry backoff for RPC methods.
member.returns: The "Default" retry backoff for RPC methods.
member.remarks:
The "Default" retry backoff for RPC methods is defined as:
Initial delay: 100 milliseconds
Maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Delay multiplier: 1.3

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechSettings.GetDefaultTimeoutBackoff
member.summary: "Default" timeout backoff for RPC methods.
member.returns: The "Default" timeout backoff for RPC methods.
member.remarks:
The "Default" timeout backoff for RPC methods is defined as:
Initial timeout: 60000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Maximum timeout: 60000 milliseconds

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechSettings.SyncRecognizeSettings
member.summary: for synchronous and asynchronous calls to SpeechClient.SyncRecognize and SpeechClient.SyncRecognizeAsync.
member.remarks:
The default SpeechClient.SyncRecognize and SpeechClient.SyncRecognizeAsync are:
Initial retry delay: 100 milliseconds
Retry delay multiplier: 1.3
Retry maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Initial timeout: 60000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Timeout maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Retry will be attempted on the following response status codes:
Default RPC expiration is 600000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechSettings.AsyncRecognizeSettings
member.summary: for synchronous and asynchronous calls to SpeechClient.AsyncRecognize and SpeechClient.AsyncRecognizeAsync.
member.remarks:
The default SpeechClient.AsyncRecognize and SpeechClient.AsyncRecognizeAsync are:
Initial retry delay: 100 milliseconds
Retry delay multiplier: 1.3
Retry maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Initial timeout: 60000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Timeout maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Retry will be attempted on the following response status codes:
Default RPC expiration is 600000 milliseconds.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1Beta1.SpeechClient.ShutdownDefaultChannelsAsync
member.summary: Shuts down any channels automatically created by and . Channels which weren't automatically created are not affected.
member.remarks: After calling this method, further calls to and will create new channels, which could in turn be shut down by another call to this method.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous shutdown operation.
